title: Short-Intensive Course on Flipped Learning-Based Integrated Engineering Language Education

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational engineering concepts, digital device proficiency, and basic reading/writing skills for engineering texts
context.additional_context: Low-cost technology utilization to enhance accessibility of engineering education for general citizens. Focuses on resolving language barriers for non-engineering majors through systematizing engineering terminology and supporting technical documentation writing.

learning_goals: Learners analyze engineering text materials provided in a flipped learning environment and can linguistically and conceptually explain five core concepts with over 80% accuracy.

Through collaborative activities, learners apply three technical documentation skills (writing, presentation, discussion) required for engineering problem-solving processes as linguistic communication tools.
In a BYOD environment, learners use digital tools to submit engineering design process outcomes in technical report format with 90% completeness.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
